Reviews.Title: “Great value, straightforward.”
Reviews.Author: JHCHayward
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights Tempio di Pallade. It was clean, the service in reception was friendly and helpful, marking bus routes and extra info onto the free map they gave us. The room itself was cosy but clean and in good condition, although the shower door was a bit ricketty. It's definitely very easy to hear through the walls, but unless you're a light sleeper or a perfectionist that can be very easily overlooked considering the price of the rooms. Breakfast was okay, but the coffee was pretty awful. The area itself looks a little run down, but it's not the flea infested pit that some reviewers have described. Overall, definitely worth booking as a budget base camp for exploring the city. Nowhere near as horrendous as some of the pearl-clutching reviews here seem to describe it.

Reviews.Title: “recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tereza R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights during our weekend in Rome where we went for the first time. Staff is very helpful, explains route to some sights, metro and buses. Room was clean and nicely furnished. It is true that during the night it is quite noisy but to be fair it is not about the thin walls but screaming people on the hallway. Breakfast was fine, breakfast surroundings not so, that is why I put one star less. Overall I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hope that Never Ever...”
Reviews.Author: Agg A
Reviews.Content: I was there last week, with 2 kids (10 and 12). Neighbourhood scary, dirty and unsafe: dirty streets, many homeless people, be carefull: everywhere on the streets are dog's fences and trashes. It is about 20 minutes of rather quick walk from Termini: even during the day it is - walking along the Via Giolitti to Termini - hard experience. During the night or very early in the morning - only if desperated. The closest metro station is Manzoni: about 4-5 minutes of walk. But not nice after dark. Hotel: staff rather nice. Room was cleaned everyday, towels were changed too. And it is all about good sides. First but the most annoying disadvantage is that the walls are made probably from paper :). You can hear every single word from the rooms next to yours. You can hear, when other guests wake up, use the toilet or shover, watch tv or open the window. In my case there was at this time a school group - about 40 people, who completely turned my staying there in horror. Laughing, speaking really loud, walking between the rooms - for two nights I could not close my eyes, my kids of course too. Staff did not react. Third night I started to hit the wall and it helped, but only a little. Very loud flush in the toilet: you are affraid to use it at night, because it seems that all guests must wake up. On breakfast it were the rolls and horrible bread, 2 kind of hams, cheese, honey and jam. Cofee, juices, tea and some yogurts (disgusting) from machine. But it was hard to drink anything from it: when I saw, that the clean hot water from this machine is dirty yellow... I did not want to know, what was in cofee or juice. Staff did not clean the tables regulary. Of course, when I went for breakfast after the school group I have to wait for food, and often not everything was filled. Generally, after all my experiences (it would take too long to write it here) I would not recommend it in any case, maybe exceptionlly if you are teenage and you don't care about sleeping and eating. Maybe the cost are low, but when you go for hollidays you need to relax yourself and you have to be relaxed to walk for whole day. In my opinion in this hotel it is not possible. Sorry for my english :)

Reviews.Title: “Our Luggage Was Worried”
Reviews.Author: hereandthere
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tempio Di Pallade for one night on our way to Civitivecchia for a cruise. It was important to us to be able to walk to the hotel from Termini Station even after dark - about 8:30pm. Pleased to say the walk was okay, took about 25 - 30 minutes with roller bags, but because street runs parallel to the tracks, we could feel the shadows watching us along the way. No problems though, we are happy to report. The man behind the desk at the hotel was efficient and did speak English, bonus for us. The room we were assigned was not a three star but everything worked in budget Italian fashion - small room, high cielings, long drapes, a recessed window, tiny bathroom, quiet. We asked about restaurants nearby and were given a couple of recommendations. Mmmm delicious - pasta in Rome with candlelight and red wine on a perfect evening - how can you get better than that? We were so happy from the fun at dinner that we overlooked any shortages in the hotel. Breakfast room was busy and although not outstanding, the food was adequate. If the price was right we would to stay at the hotel again, but we would prefer to be a little closer to Termini..

Reviews.Title: “Not good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Shellbell_981
Reviews.Content: I will be honest that I have often read trip advisor reviews for hotels before travelling, been really worried by what I have read only to turn up to a hotel and find it is perfectly acceptable and value for money. Unfortunately on this occasion that was not the case. When we booked the room we were made aware that we would be in the annex, this was not a problem to us, we were happy to walk to breakfast and if anything we thought it might be a bit quieter than the main hotel, how wrong we would be. When we arrived and checked in the two gentlemen behind the desk couldn't have been more friendly, they spent ages showing us all of the sites on a map, including transport links and recommendations of places to go and eat, this information proved to very accurate and invaluable, we used that map for our entire trip. We were then greated by the receptionist from the annex who collected us from the main reception and escorted us to the annex, she again was very friendly and recommended a restaurant for us to eat at just around the corner which ended up being the nicest and best value for money restaurant that we ate at. On first impression we were happy with our room, it was a good size with one double bed and bunk beds (we had booked a twin room) and an adequate sized bathroom with shower, we also had our own little terrace outside which we liked. There was a problem with our safe which we reported to the staff and they sorted out promptly. Unfortunately when we returned from a meal on the first evening and went to bed we found our main problem, our room was right next to the reception and the wall was very thin, probably only a partition wall, we could hear every person who came in and out all night and at 6am the recption staff changed shift and stood in the recption area talking loudly for over half an hour, eventually I had to go to reception in my pyjamas and ask them to be quiet, they apologised but continued to talk quietly and let the door slam on their way in and out. The second night was even worse, there were a group of male students staying in the upstairs rooms, they shouted laughed and moved furniture round until 2am when again I had to go to reception in my pyjamas to ask them to do something about it, then once we finally got to sleep at 6am we were woken again by the reception staff changing shift who seem to have forgotten all about my request from the night before for them to be quiet. By the morning we were very tired, two nights with poor sleep was ruining our trip as we were too tired during the day to make the most of our time here so I went to the main reception and complained. They eventually reluctantly agreed to move us to another room, although they were fairly unsympathetic and at no point did they ever apologise to us. We were moved to the second floor of the annex and I would like to say that was the end of the problem but we were put into a room right next door to the students and whilst it was a small improvement on being in the room underneath them the noise and the broken sleep continued, despite us purchasing ear plugs in the pharmacy! On the last night I had to open the door in my pyjamas yet again to ask 4 male students who were stood right outside of our door having a conversation to be quiet. The breakfast was also very disapointing, again I had read previous reviews on here regarding the quality of the breakfast so I wasn't expecting great things but for me the most annoying thing was that they would constantly run out of cups, plates,glasses, cutlery etc so even if there was any breakfast left after the teenagers had taken huge platefuls of food there was nothing to eat it or drink it from. Overall this hotel was very disapointing, yes the location was quite good for termini station and sight seeing and some of the staff were extremly friendly and helpful but this was about all it had going for it and the lack of sleep that we experienced over our 4 night stay ruined our overall enjoyment of the trip. It wasn't an expensive hotel, and believe me I am the first person to moan when people pay budget prices for hotel rooms and then complain on here because it wasn't the Ritz but I do not feel that this hotel represents good value for money and I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bit noisy, but not as bad as all the reviews say !”
Reviews.Author: Nybor123
Reviews.Content: Very clean and comfortable. But not the prettiest side of town! Very noisy due to proximity to trains! However my daughter and i had no trouble sleeping as trains don't run all night! Breakfast was adequate And overall our stay was pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “They stole $1500”
Reviews.Author: TataSnows
Reviews.Content: Our friend had $1500 stolen from her money box in her suitcase-hopefully that's enough to turn u away but if not here's a few more reasons not to stay here: -All of our stuff was searched through, things were not how we left them. -There is no air-con -the stairs are slippery & we slipped The good things: reception stuff were super friendly, breaky was good, location is the best!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Solchiks
Reviews.Content: We were surprised upon our arrival because the hotel was better we expected. A little bit too far from main attractions, but quiet neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here!”
Reviews.Author: sarahk1130
Reviews.Content: Like some of the other reviewers, we did a blind booking through Hotwire -- which I've now decided to never use again because of our experience at Tempio. It's in an unsafe area, the nearby train sounds like it's INSIDE your room, there is no air conditioning, no Internet, the breakfast was inedible, and the shower was just a shower head coming out of the wall next to the toilet -- there was not even a curtain. It was so bad, that even these price-sensitive travelers decided to eat the cost of the second night we'd paid for and go somewhere else. Try the Hotel Borromeo instead, about half a mile away -- it's economical but lightyears better.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: mich1910
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and were rather diappointed with the hotel. the website said recently renovated but this could not have included the rooms! Our room was small, with very noisy air con and toilet flush, not to mention the bed mattress was so old that the springs were broken. The window was also cracked. It was, however very clean and there was a safe and a TV. Be warned that there is also a tram line directly next to the hotel and the trams are VERY noisy all through the night! We also had a few bad experiences with noisy guests but this was rectified by the receptionist. Breakfast was by far the worst we have ever experienced, with only a selection of two cereals, milk, bread (not toast), rolls (hard) and ham and cheese. There is a hot drinks and a juice machine. The staff only appear to clear the tables and fill up the food and plates. Because the selection of food and plates was so small, it quickly run out and the guests soon became like vultures fighting for the food. On the plus side, the hotel is situated approx 15 mins walk on the same road as Termini, the main train station which did provide us with excellent access to the train station. Be wary of getting a taxi from the station to the hotel as we were greatly overcharged and taken on a tour of the center! There are four great restaurants two streets away with delicious and not overpriced food. Unfortunately, we would not recommend this hotel if you like your sleep and your breakfast, but if you just need to be near the station on a budget then it is probably ok.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: Dimmolnay
Reviews.Content: The place was clean, staff were friendly. If I travel again only with girlfriends, maybe not be back there only because I found it a little bit far from the bus stop when going home late in the evening. Probably worse in winter when it is darker. Breakfast had good selection. No internet connection.

Reviews.Title: “Rude, disorganized and overpriced, sleazy hotel”
Reviews.Author: jillglaze
Reviews.Content: We arrived to find out that there was a "problem with a pipe" and that we were unable to stay at the hotel but that they had "made us a reservation" at the Midi Hotel (which was a block away and looked like a strip club). We were told that we could stay at the Midi for one night then return to Tempo for our last 2 nights. We noticed that a name (possibly ours) had been erased off the room list and that another name was there (at a rate over twice what we paid). We did book the hotel through Hotwire and felt we were bumped b/c of the price we paid (it was the Ascension Thursday long weekend). The white haired gentleman behind the desk was flustered and downright rude (he told me to "be quiet and it down" while he attempted to convince my boyfriend that we would like staying at the Midi instead. We refused to stay elsewhere given we paid to stay at this hotel. The neighborhood is filthy and unsafe - we saw a pile of human feces with toilet paper on it 2 blocks away. This made coming home later at night a bit uncomfortable. The breakfast was disgusting - stale rolls and small hamburger buns with jelly, dark water (apparently coffee). The rooms were clean, but the walls rather thin. You have to call the front desk to have them turn on the air conditioning - which they at times choose to turn off - and they are unable to control the temperature (there are 2 options - on or off). Stay here if desperate only.

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to the negative reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: rpotter68
Reviews.Content: I had read many negatives about this hotel before arriving, and have to say after spending 5 nights there myself and my two friends very very happy with it, it was clean, the room was a perfect size, wonderfully placed for easy access to all the sights and the staff were very helpful gave us lots of info and very friendly! this hotel is fantastic value yes it is basic but what do people expect for the cost! give it a go you wont be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: AngeKenos
Reviews.Content: Imagine walking with heavy luggage on a very rough road away from the hotel. It is in two parts. Then down stairs and then up several flights - no lift. Then rude breakfast staff and a minimalist breakfast at that. And yet we paid more for this 3 star than we did for luxurious five star across much of Greece. We could not recommend this venue to a flea.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Rating Fraudulent”
Reviews.Author: aligator1837
Reviews.Content: Advertises on Hotwire.com as a 3 star hotel with restaurant, coffee shop, minibar, bell hop service. Upon check-in non of the above actually came to be. The hotel actually seems to cater to high school groups, who run wild in the hallways. Breakfast was DREADFUL, coffee undrinkable. Lastely, on hotwire we were asked to pay certain fees and taxes, but on arrival were asked to pay additional fees. My advise from this experience - run, don;t walk as fast as you can. Deal with the cc charges later. There are such nice hotels in the area

Reviews.Title: “absolutely dreadful,do not stay here under any circumstances”
Reviews.Author: kiapops
Reviews.Content: sleazy part of town,certainly a "no go"zone at night and not pleasant at all to walk anywhere through the day!Too far to walk anywhere as thro undesirable area,staff rude and condescending,facilities dingy,never seen a twin room so small-we were unable to get our suitcases in anb shut the door!Mine had to be lifted over the narrowest of beds ever encounted and placed on a window sill!!!Couldn't even stay 1 night so relocated to a much nicer area 1-2 klms away with tratorrias all nearby and no need for cabs.Leave well alone if you want to enjoy your time in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: JoukoEspoo
Reviews.Content: All receptionists were friendly. The rooms were clean. The hotel is within walking distance of the Manzoni or Termini metro stations. Breakfast was adequate. The only negative thing about the hotel was the poor soundproofing between rooms.

Reviews.Title: “We would have struggled to find a worse value hotel in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: 255100Elizabeth
Reviews.Content: I previously thought that reviews whinging about the inadequacies of three star hotels were really from people wanting 5 star service at 3 star price. However, in the case of Hotel di Pallade, all the bad reviews are correct. This hotel is barely 2 star. Why? It IS close to the train station, but that means it is close to a dodgy area (graffiti, far from the historical and shopping centre). You will also get stale bread rolls for breakfast. Ask for an extra pillow, and you will be met with indifference. The lobby, the lift and stairwells reek of smoke. The ensuite bathroom had noticeable layer of dust on the toiletries and hairs left on the "clean" towels. The bathroom light flickered constantly, needed replacing. The shutters on the window did not open/close properly. When we arrived, with a prepaid booking, we were asked to stay in one room the first night, then move to another, because the first room required maintenance. And the hotel is completely full (he said), so no choice to decline. This hotel is lousy value - if you would like three star you will be disappointed, and if you are on a budget, look elsewhere for better value. Avoid this hotel, you will undoubtedly find better value in Rome elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think about it”
Reviews.Author: ORFranP86
Reviews.Content: This place was TERRIBLE. First off, the "double" is two twin beds. If you want a double, they just push the two twin beds together and put a sheet over it. Our room had an exposed sewer pipe that when anyone on the floor above went to the bathroom or took a shower, we got serenaded by the sound of water. Not a pleasant experience at 230 in the morning. The hotel was filled with young students, partying all night. When we complained to the front desk their comments were to the effect, that is what young people do. The room is tiny. The one good thing about this hotel is the breakfast is good. I personally didn't experience any rudeness of the staff. There was an extremely helpful gentleman on the evening that was obviously very proud of Rome, directed us to some sites that we probably would have missed and are glad we didn't. The basic room was clean and well maintained. THIS IS NOT A NEIGHBORHOOD FOR THOSE THAT WANT TO GO OUT AT NIGHT!.

Reviews.Title: “You can find a better hotel”
Reviews.Author: Krispy831
Reviews.Content: This hotel was below average. The staff was rude from the minute we walked in where the clerk indignantly announced we were early only to say less than 30 seconds later that our room was ready. They didn’t offer us a map even though you can see it behind them at the counter, they didn’t go over the use of the safe until we asked about it and as soon as we asked questions or advice there suddenly became a language barrier. Rooms were small but clean. Our room wasn’t cleaned which didn’t bother us as they gave us fresh towels when we asked. The bed is not a mattress but more like a cot and extremely hard and uncomfortable. There are better hotels for the same amount of money in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “There are better options that will ensure your stay is more enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: schmango
Reviews.Content: This hotel was poor, most of the staff were not helpful and appeared disappointed to be there, the hotel looks great on a map but the main station does not get you around the city quickly so this is a 10 minute walk to get to a station to go anywhere interesting. The rooms were absolutely tiny, we could hardly fit two 65cm suitcases on the floor beside the bed. The front desk controls the air conditioning and wants to hold on to your key at all times? I would definitely not stay here again. This hotel has alot of outside noise so opening a window is not an option if you are a light sleeper. The buffet breakfast was the worst we had seen after 5 weeks in europe and consisted of bread rolls and hams and cheese with one cereal and most days it would run out at 9am prior to it finishing at 10am?

Reviews.Title: “Average basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: MicheleGu
Reviews.Content: Simple 3* hotel in a good location, with metro 2min walking that we used to go to the Vatican. Small room, but clean. It was all we needed. There was a very nice restaurant very close. The railway station to go to the airport 10 min walking strait away.

Reviews.Title: “The loaction is the only good thing about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Apples096
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel through a package deal at our tavel agent. We took Magana tours( located at the airport) for our hotel transfers.They were great- you could also buy trips off them - better priced than we got in Australia. for The hotel location is great to get to a lot of attractions and jump on a hop on hop off bus.Best to get the ticket in Italy approx eu $19 each for a 48hour ticket. The hotel had an older manager who was very kind and could speak well enough english.He directed us to two great restaurants close by.The breakfast was include in the price. The food was basic. On one occasion the small breakfast room had 100 people in it- mainly french high schoolers. They eat and drank nearly every scrap of food and drink .We tried to find kitchen staff ,but the kitchen was empty.My husband finally found one staff member outside. It seemed the rostered staff were half an hour late. The first staff member them started to slam vacant chairs in the table as the young ones left.Then she started to yell at the late staff.The room was tiny, the heating cut out at night, the TV worked once.But the best came from the bathroom. My husband is a large man ,but his stomach touching the controls stopped the water,He couldn't properly shower or move - I had to shampoo his hair because he couldn't raise his arms.I am not a big person but I could hardly move and the screen doors fell off all the time.After a while it wasn't funny.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Go There.”
Reviews.Author: Madison128
Reviews.Content: We were told it was a short walk from the railway station. Untrue. About half an hour. Footpaths for about 5 minutes, then it got scary. We were on the wrong side of the road, we didn't know we had to lug bags over railway lines over bricks...ferrible. Then the hotel itself. Looked presentable. The room was tiny for the 350.00 aud we paid. the shower screen fell off. You had to call for the air con to be put on, then again if it was too col or too warm. Once the old man at reception was asleep when we left the keys! We needed a doctor....the reception was rude..threw a book around the counter..just didn't want to help could only help with a German speaking doctor. It was in a terrible position. A taxi to get anywhere, Huge garbage bins were across the road, grafitti everywhere. don't go there. Flight Center booked us in. We called into a few other hotels in the city and enquired about their prices...equal or cheaper. If a travel agent suggests this hotel flatly refuse. Enough said.

Reviews.Title: “No luxury hotel, but more than we expected. Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: ViennaMichael
Reviews.Content: We stayd for a weekend in Rome with friends from Feb.4-6. Since they did not want to spend to much for the hotel, they chose Tempio di Pallade. We payd € 107 per room for two nights. For that price ans reading all the negative reviews we did not expect too much. Overall - we were very much positively surprised. Location: The Hotel is located ov via Giolitti, 10 minutes walk from Romes train station Termini. From the airport there is the Leonardo Express train, 20 minutes non-stop for 11 Euros. The area is typical train station area, not too good, and lots of Graffiti. But we never felt unsave although we walked back to the hotel every night. There are two underground stations closeby and lots of buses and trams. In 15 minutes you are at every sight. Hotel: The hotel consists of two buildings, quite old but very well maintained. The lobby looks very nice, hotel was speaking basic english and was very friendly. There are two vending machines with water, drings and snacks in the lobby. The breakfas room was in the basement, breakfast was included in our rate. For italian standards it was very good, sausages, cheese, white bread, marmelade and butter. Cerials and two machines, one for coffee (we did lot like it) and juices. But we did not care, there are plenty of cafes around for good coffee. Room: Our room 237 was on 2nd floor with a view of a silent back street. Room was small but very clean. Comfortable bed and a small bathroom with a perfect shower. Strong water pressure and all amenities. There was also aircondition but we did not need it. At the last day we could put our luggage in a locked luggage room until we left for the airport. Tipps: We bought a Rome pass before we went to Rome. With it most sights can be visited for free. Also got a 3 day pass for public transport, highly recommend that. The best is, to walk around a lot, most sights are in pedestian areas. Be careful, some restaurants, especially in downtown area around Fontana di Trevi rip you off. We found some very nice restaurants in TRAVESTERE area. This is a district with lots of small bars and restaurants where he local people eat. Pizzas from 4 Euro, had gread fish for less than 50 % compared to downtown. Great area to wlak around, real italian atmosphere with little streets and shops. Overall: We would stay there again and recommend it to everybody not expecting a luxury hotel. It was definitively worth the money. Clean, great water pressure, nice and helpfull staff.

Reviews.Title: “It is a basic hotel but convenient”
Reviews.Author: MVLVA
Reviews.Content: The hotel is basic. The location is not the best, but it is not very far from Termini railway station. You can catch a bus or a tram at Piazza Porta Maggiore, which is about 200 meters from the hotel. The rooms are small but comfortable and perfectly OK if you want the room just to sleep. The beds are confortable and it is all very tidy. Breakfast is perfectly satisfactory. Very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE UNLESS U R ABSOLUTELY DESPERATE FOR A ROOM.”
Reviews.Author: 1122334455WENWA
Reviews.Content: Unless you envision your rome vacation to be in a fog of cigarette smoke sleeping on army cots DON"T COME HERE. Though there are no smoking signs everywhere, it is apparently a rule that the staff chainsmoke non stop, particularly in the breakfast rooms. The young man at the front desk will lie about fixing stuff (yeah, our drain in the bathroom didn't drain despite his repeated assurance he would have it fixed). I was embarrassed for them. There are much nicer places better located closer, though the Termini Station area is very handy for all the sights. I am actually on site while writing this. Spend an extra 20 euros and stay someplace that does not disgust you and someplace where the staff has actually some pride in their work and the value of their word. I would never, ever, ever recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not for Family with Young Children”
Reviews.Author: nmakai
Reviews.Content: Although the staff were friendly I would not stay here again. The rooms are way to small for two adults and two children. They had no facilities at all in regards to a small bar fridge, tea/coffee making, iron etc. You had to ask reception if you wanted the air conditioner on and even though we were in a non smoking room you could smell smoking. Breakfast was included but the choice was small - including no cold milk at all to have with cereal (we supplied our own). I did not appreciate the fact that people were smoking in a room just of reception, most times my husband had to ask queries and I waited outside with the children, discusting. Not really a good area either.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel well located”
Reviews.Author: romisek
Reviews.Content: In this hotel there is everything you need to have a nice stay In Rome. It is easy to find. The train from airport goes twice an hour to Termini station, from there you can go by indicators directly to Via G Giolitti, then you can go one stop by yellow tram with no number, however it is not so far. In hotel there is funny man, the room was nice with double bed, wardrobe, safe and bathroom. AC worked well, but you can´t regulate it yourselves, but whenever you can call the reception to turn it on or off. The breakfast seemed to me very big, there is a coffe and tea machine, juice machine, shake machine, cereals, corn flakes, bread, toasts, salame, ham, cheese, butter, marmelade, honey. Only thing I missed was the vegetables. This hotel is really in the center, so everything is close and buses, trams and metro go very often. We went back to the hotel late at night every day and this is aslo not any problem, there is still somebody.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant hotel with friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: JocastaTravels
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend for 3 nights in July and we found it very pleasant. Hotel was easy to find, it was only about 10 - 15 mins walk from the middle entrance of the train station and it was on the same street so we were never lost. The open top bus routes also terminated at the Termini, so again, easy to find our way back from long days out in Rome. Rooms were large enough, although no air-con so very warm at night. Bathroom was clean with good water pressure in the shower. Breakfasts were better than expected, the usual bread (all white), cheese, meats, yoghurt machine, 2 types of cereal, hot drinks machine and cold drinks machine. There was also packets of melba toasts and biscuits. You could arrange to take out breakfast as packed lunch, if you wanted. The staff were very friendly and spoke good English, only the lady waiting on in the breakfast room didn't, but it was easy to make yourself understood. We found two lovely cafe/restaurants just along from the hotel for evening meals, the one futher down the street was a little cheaper but delicious homemade food was served. We didn't drink alcohol as it was too hot and we ate for about 15 - 30 euros each, depending on how many courses we ate! If you wanted to go back into Rome center you were next to the Metro. All in all, I'd recommend if you are looking for basic, clean accommodation in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we expected!”
Reviews.Author: JosieGirlPerth
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at the Tempio Di Pallade for one night before joining our tour group - we wish we'd stayed longer. Not much street appeal when we arrived but once we walked into the hotel, we were pleasantly surprised. We were told that Italians aren't concerned about the external appearance of their residences but take a great deal of pride inside - this is a perfect example of that. On arrival, the concierge was extremely helpful and spoke very good English. As we'd spent the previous 20 hours travelling, we explained that we didn't want to sleep in the middle of the day, he kindly offered a few suggestions on how to spend the afternoon and provided a map to help us get around. To our surprise, we were only a very pleasant 20 minute walk to the Colosseum and the Roman Forum! We felt very safe walking between the Hotel and the Colosseum - taking in the sights, smells and savouring some delicious pastries along the way. There was a choice of restaurants around the corner from the hotel for Dinner and we were not disappointed with our selection (suggested by the concierge). Our hotel room was just beautiful. As expected in Europe, it was small but appeared renovated, lovingly decorated and space was well utilised. Yes, the bathroom was small but lovely (much smaller shower than we're used to but no problems here). We even had a small tv in our room. The bed was very comfortable and the room was quiet and very clean. Breakfast supplies were more than adequate and we were impressed with the service and quality of the food. Overall, we were very impressed with this boutique hotel and would definitely stay again and recommend to our friends. We are very grateful for the wonderful customer service provided by the concierge and wish that more hotels could follow their lead. We experienced many hotels throughout our European trip and the Tempio Di Pallade provided one of the more pleasant memories.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at Tempio”
Reviews.Author: Thorns60
Reviews.Content: We are a 60 year old couple who had a great time at the Tempio Hotel. We stayed 5 days, and as we enjoy walking and we found that it was an easy walk to anywhere in Rome we wanted to go, it was also located close to some really good restaurants at fair dinkum prices. The staff were very good, helpful, and interested in making our stay a happy one. The hotel cannot be blamed for the graffiti on neighbouring buildings, graffiti is all over Rome, as it is in Sydney and other major cities. At no stage we were concerned about our safety. After 5 days we moved to the Cicerone Hotel for 2 nights to commence a tour, this 5 star hotel could provide nothing like the service of the Tempio, nor the ambience and friendly style.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Shelly053
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here before our return flight to Singapore. Reception staff upon arrival were rude and provided no advice on where to eat or even in which direction to walk. We were told we were close to the train station more like a 10 minute walk with luggage in a very dodgy area. I feel we were given an inferior room because we were staying only one night. The room barely held our three suitcases. No air conditioning and very noisy leaving the window open all night. Shower doors fell off, bathroom / toilet were the size of a closet. Upon arrival we asked for assistance to confirm our airport transfer and were told to come back later. Breakfast was adequate and attentive service. The reception staff were much more helpful the next day and offered assistance in contacting our transfer service. Not good value for the price. Interestingly upon arrival at Le Termini there was a last-minute Hotels desk and many people offering last minute deals for travellers.

Reviews.Title: “bad experience”
Reviews.Author: MisterMAyrshire
Reviews.Content: Having travelled with this company before I had no hesitation about using them a second time. However the hotel was less than satisfactory, the hotel was 25 minutes away from the railway station, the area was very undesirable and felt unsafe. The hotel was overbooked and we were given an alternative room which was very small, there was barely enough room for the double bed and it badly needed decorated. The bathroom was very small, about the size of a large cupboard and the shower cabinet had only half a door. On the whole not a nice experience, I wouldn't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: molvo
Reviews.Content: Location: Yes this hotel is a bit of a walk from Termini station ( not more than 10 mins) but at no time did we ever feel scared. The walk to the coleseum is also about 20 min don't waist money on a cab because it is very pleasant for sightseeing. Reception: The reception hall is very simple and nice and the receptionists (the two that we met) were extremely helpful and spoke perfect english. Room: The room we stayed in had clearly just been remodeled, amazing high ceilings, big bathroom, comfy bed, and very very clean. We had a small lcd tv on the wall but never turned it on. Breakfast: Again simple but very nice, in a very large room on the ground floor. Coffee (don't forget your razor because it will put hair on your chest ), juice, milk, rolls, cold cuts, cheese ,jams, perfect to start the day out. Overall; Great value!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Teach2travel07
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here from July 20-23, 2007. We didn't know what to expect after reading some of the reviews, but we were pleasantly surprised upon our arrival. It may have been because we'd been traveling for over 24 hours, but in any case, it was nice. We checked in close to 1 am and the process was quick and friendly. Our room was at the end of the hall and very quiet. It was small as expected and had a lovely bathroom. Hot water, newer fixtures, and good shower pressure. There was a small fridge in the room which wasn't expected, so bonus! The bed isn't luxurious, but it gets the job done after long hours of walking Rome in the July heat. The breakfast offers bread, meat, and coffee. It's enough to get you started in the morning. The day we left, our train didn't leave until 6pm, so we needed a place to leave our bags. The hotel stored them in a locked room and we retrieved them later in the day with no problem. Also, I know many reviewers say the hotel isn't in the best neighborhood, but we (two women) had no problems. It was after midnight when we got out of Termini station to get to the hotel and we didn't run into any difficulty. Actually, I asked for directions and was given them without issue. The people were terrific and don't be scared of the grafitti. It is in the vicinity of every transportation station in Europe! No big deal. When exiting the hotel, turn left and walk about five minutes on the same side of the street to a restaurant named The Divine Comedy. It has an awning (with a different name on it), faces the street, and has a fish tank in the front. We loved the food here and the owner, Tony, was terrific. He told us where to go, how to get there, what to avoid, etc. He and his buddies were helpful, entertaining, and very memorable. Overall, I was worried for nothing and it reminds me not to believe everything I read. It is all about what you truly expect for what you paid and remembering you're on vacation, so enjoy yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Hated this hotel”
Reviews.Author: DianeMcCalifornia
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and the lobby was very pleasant but that did not make up for all the other problems. While the hotel is a 10 minute walk to the train station the neighborhood is very questionable and it's a long walk to anything you might want to sightsee. Our room was very noisy as it was right by the tracks. The windows were old and wouldn't stay shut. The bed was very uncomfortable. There was no hot water. The breakfast was dreadful, basically what tasted like instant coffee and dry toast. This hotel is definitely not a good value. Luckily we were only there for one night before our return flight but this was not what I wanted my last memories of Rome to be. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel in a questionable location”
Reviews.Author: Couple-in-30s
Reviews.Content: March 5-8, 2007 This is a clean little hotel with a lovely lobby that you really wonder how it ended up on the street it did. This is about a 15 minute walk from the main train station. The street is heavy with graffiti in places and you will pass some dumpsters along the way. However, we walked this path several times very late at night and during the daylight and did not feel particularly unsafe. The area is populated and there are a handful of restaurants & shops along the street. This is obviously a lower end commercial district without much residential population. Location aside, the hotel is charming. We stayed in room 231. We had a very high ceiling (nice to muffle noise) and a lovely view of a courtyard (a bit under-repaired). The room was mostly quiet (but you did hear the trains going down the tracks a block or so away). We had a full size bed (a rarity in Europe) and the bathroom was recently updated. The shower was tiny. Probably only 4 foot by 4 foot square. Our room had two plug-in outlets (one in the bathroom, one by the bedside). The TV was very small and only carried Italian language stations. We suspect the hot water situation has a great deal to do with when you shower. We had no problem with hot water in the evening, before 7:30 in the AM or after 9:30 in the AM. We did find the lukewarm water to be a problem when we got up at 8:30 AM. We encountered three different front desk persons, each of whom spoke English and were very friendly. The night desk clerk (maybe 11-7 shift?) was particularly kind and took the time to visit with us our first night. Breakfast is hosted by a server who brings a basket of rolls, toast, some yummy cookie like things, as well as coffee, tea & milk. They also had some orange drink that tasted like Tang. They brought a little salami, cheese & ham also that you could put on your rolls to make a sandwich. More than enough food and very pleasant. I would not recommend this location for anyone with small children, difficulty with carrying bags 500m, or arriving particularly late or after a very long flight. It is a bit of a walk and it does not appear to be the most savory neighborhood. For those who are comfortable with the walk and a bit of graffiti, you will find a little gem tucked away at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Do not go here.”
Reviews.Author: reg77
Reviews.Content: We booked this through an agent in Australia before we heard about trip adviser. (what a mistake) Walking from the train station after 20 hours on planes and buses, our first experience of europe was unfortunatley not pleasant. The area which we walked through was filthy, smelly and felt unsafe. We felt a little better when we entered the foyer as it was clean and well presented. When we arrived at our room we were utterly dissappointed. A very basic a bed, tv, wardrobe and a bathroom. The bathroom looked like it was from the 1930's. the drain was sticking out of the ground, which we fixed and we turned the shower on ready for a nice hot shower. The water dribbled out like someone pouring a 2 litre coke bottle from the wall and it was cold, we left it running for three minutes or so with our thongs/jandals on as the bathroom did not feel clean. The manager said they have hot water so we tried again and after about 5 mins a little luke warm water arrived. All in all not worth visiting at the price being charged. We changed hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After flying from Newark to Paris (7 hrs) to Rome (2 hrs) and then taking the Leonardi (35 min) to Termini, we walked down a very sketchy street to the Tempio di Pallade (although most streets in non-tourist Rome are similar, poorly lit with graffiti and homeless people). We had booked the room in August for a trip in March. When we got to Tempio di Pallade we were told they were overbooked, and were told to go to a hotel a few blocks away. I had heard about this as a scam and so was very apprehensive, but we had no choice as they had no where for us to stay. Fortunately, the Hotel Taormina was very nice (although under construction) and the clerks were very helpful. I would not recommend booking at Tempio if you don't want to risk not having a place to stay after travelling for 13+ hours!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Walk”
Reviews.Author: DeetheDub
Reviews.Content: A good 20 mins walk from Termini Station down dark busy street, nearer Port di Maggiore than Termini. Exterior clean & bright, a small reception, marbled and warm, with a couple of vending machines offering water, soft drinks, coffee, chocolate etc. Rooms basic - but everything you need, cleaned daily and fresh towels too. Breakfast as per other reports - tea, coffee, watery juice and hard rolls but enough to get you started. A leisurely 15 minute walk to nearest Metro, area might be off putting to some so a taxi to Spanish Steps for example was €9.20. 30 minute walk max to Colosseum - BRING TRAINERS, forget fashion! Great Budget hotel, helpful staff and for the price you need look no further if you're used to roughing it a little bit. You won't be pampered here but if all you want is a base to head back to for the night then this is it! And a tip for travellers - write the name/address of the hotel down and hand to a taxi driver before you get into the car - it's not that they won't bring you as far as the hotel, more that they won't understand what you're saying so tend to shrug and say "no". We'd no problems at all!

Reviews.Title: “definitely budget class”
Reviews.Author: beckywill
Reviews.Content: +Although the staff were unfailingly polite, this is not the most convenient hotel to stay at. The walk from the train station is rather long and completely along an ancient cobblestone street and sidewalk. Traffic is what you expect to find in Rome during most times of day; dangerous! We found that cab drivers were unwilling to take the fare as they would be unlikely to find a return fare. (We had reserved the shuttle service from the airport in advance and were happy we had done so; $20/pp.) Cable car and buses DO pass the address but we had not researched that ahead as we only had a day and a half stay with the Air France Holiday package. Recommend you check out the public transit specifics if you are staying a few days. Room was clean but shower is a nozzle on the wall in the bathroom so be prepared to dry off the toilet and walk on a wet floor in that room afterward. Breakfast consists of hard rolls and jam, orange juice and coffee/tea. We did find one nice restaurant a couple blocks away, toward the train station, for dinner. A busier part of town with many 3-star tourist hotels (and the requisite eating establishments)is not too far away.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read reviews on the hotel after having already booked, so wasn't expecting much. The walk from the train station does take around twenty mins, which seemed an eternity at one in the morning. Although arriving late we were greeted warmly and too my surprise our room was spotlessly clean and had no smell. The breakfast was continental style, but guess what! we are on the continent so what do you expect. The rooms were cleaned every day, the staff were friendly, even to us non Italian speaking British. I would have no problem recommending this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Perfect For The Money & A City Break!”
Reviews.Author: nymills
Reviews.Content: Having come across this site just two days before we went to rome we were left worrying what exactly we might find when we arrived, but were pleased the hotel proved the previous comments to be wrong. The hotel is located in a more undesirable area (near the station) but it is not in any way an area which made me fear for my saftey. It is however a 30minute walk to the centre. The hotel was nicely decorated with modern bathroom facilites it was also extremley clean. The staff were friendly and very helpful. Breakfast was provided although it was only rolls with jam, tea and coffee. For the money i paid it was extremely good value and i would definately recommend it for a city break!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We found the Tempio di Pallade to be quite nice and adequate for the money we spent. While the neighborhood was not the best Rome had to offer, it was by far not the worst. We found that graffitti was a problem everywhere we went. Lots of inspiring artists. There were four of us, all women, and we did not feel unsafe at any time, although we were in our rooms by 9:00 p.m. each evening as we were exhausted from our busy day of sightseeing and shopping. The hotel was very clean and in good repair. Our room was one of the older ones, a good laugh at times, but the hotel was also being renovated during our stay. Forget English TV, besides you're on vacation. Take a good book or portable DVD player. Breakfast consisted of rolls, juice, and strong coffee and stuck with you throughout the morning. We could not have asked for friendlier staff. The neighborhood restaurants had very good food and were equally friendly. A 20 minute walk to Termini, 30 minute walk to Colesium. If you want a bargain without high expectations and have good walking shoes, I recommend the Tempio di Pallade.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a bit of a walk down a street which is, at times, very dark. The walk includes a great deal of graffiti on the building walls and several people sleeping on the sidewalks. Very scary walk! We were told that our room was non-smoking, but when we got there, we found ashtrays. In addition, the first night the room filled with enough cigarette smoke to make me sick to my stomach and to make my throat burn with every breath. I would not stay here again, nor recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Not as we expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my classmates booked several rooms for our study travelling through Rome in October 2004. We saw some photos online and we were very glad that everything seems to be clean and some kind of luxurious. As we arrived in Rome, our image was not approved. Unfortunately the rooms were not as described and the sanitary facilities turned up almost ridiculous. The staff was all in all friendly and cooperatively, but the whole impression of the hotel became worse. Germany, 2004

Reviews.Title: “Americans Beware - Bait & Switch if you don't speak Italian”
Reviews.Author: StuartandDenese
Reviews.Content: Americans Beware. We had reservations booked several months in advance. When we arrived on Tuesday (11/25), the desk clerk took our room certificate and then told us they were full and sent us around the corner to a dive called the Hotel Monzoni. This is a shady business practice that we call "bait and switch."The next day, we went back to try again to get our rooms at Tempio di Pallade. He said they were full and there was nothing he could do. Then the creep turned around and booked an Italian family of seven less than ten minutes after he told us there was no room.The difference? We don't speak Italian. They made it very clear that Americans are not welcome and will be treated like garbage. The hotel that we had to stay in was a filthy matchbox with leaky toilets, twin size fold up beds, and no telephones in the rooms. And the bathrooms were almost in-room port-o-lets with two-feet square showers.Please do not endorse this practice by advertising for them.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but not as expected as per description”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arrival: Easy walk from train station. A clean facility with pretty entry and breakfast room. The tv had quite a few channels, but not one in English. There was a phone in the room with instructions to call using Visa. Could not even call the desk on it. Clerk, when asked how to make a call, stated "Oh, it doesn't work. It is best to go to the Termini (train station) to make a call". This was at night and not a very good neighborhood. The day clerk did know how to do it! No drinking cups at all in room. Shower head fell off in my hand. The description states the hotel is just behind the Piazza Vittorio, actually it was at least a 20 minute walk. Breakfast consisted of Orange juice, coffee hard rolls and a few bisquits.
